snippet: Patients who received damaged defibrillator wires made by St. Jude Medical are learning that removing them can be risky, but so can leaving them in place.
abstract: Patients with implanted defibrillators containing potentially faulty wire made by St Jude Medical are struggling with the life-or-death decision of whether to have the devices removed; wire, known as the Riata, was recalled in December; patients who elect to keep the devices risk unpredictable and potentially lethal shocks when they malfunction, but the surgery to remove them comes with its own risks.
lead_paragraph: Patients who received damaged defibrillator wires made by St. Jude Medical are learning that removing them can be risky, but so can leaving them in place.

headline.seo: Many Patients With Defibrillators Face a Dilemma
headline.main: Unpredictable Danger Looms Close to the Heart
headline.print_headline: Unpredictable Danger Looms Close to the Heart
